Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 4.8 Å (original ZIF-71 pore size), reduced with Ag NP loading

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Weak sieving effect due to small molecular size

Other Information.Additional Info: Response to hydrogen increases with Ag NP loading.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Prevented from passing due to larger molecular size

Other Information.Additional Info: Response to acetone decreases with Ag NP loading.
Response to ammonia remains almost unchanged with Ag NP loading.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Reduced response indicates prevention of passage

Other Information.Additional Info: Response to hydrogen sulfide decreases greatly with Ag NP loading.

Sieving Mechanism: Encapsulation of Ag nanoparticles alters the pore characteristics, enabling selective gas adsorption.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Increased hydrogen selectivity (response increased from 24% to 44%), decreased acetone selectivity (response reduced from 67% to 24%)

Other Information.Additional Info: Ag nanoparticles encapsulated into ZIF-71 via deposition-reduction method. Encapsulation modulates pore size and enhances hydrogen selectivity while reducing acetone interaction.
